website_summaries.verdict: If you can't spend $100 or more on a universal remote, the Logitech Harmony 600 is a great choice.
pros: Powerful universal remote with great ergonomics
simple text-based LCD screen surrounded by five contextual buttons
Web programmable via Windows or Mac PCs
excellent button layout and overall design
cons: an additional $20 gets you the step-up model with a color screen and graphical icons

customer_reviews.title: Works well but limited to 5 devices
customer_reviews.text: Things I like(d): - 5 minutes to program via Internet-connected PC, very straightforward, after which... - ...correct/complete interaction with BD player (Oppo), Roku, DirecTV DVR, A/V Receiver (Marantz), TV (Sharp) - when switching activity, powers down unneeded components - back-lighting activates when remote is grabbed Not so great: - limit of 5 devices -- I also have a CD/MP3 player in my system for listening to music, but cannot add that as a sixth device - legends on buttons of remote are not as large as they could be -> need to use in good light for first several days until familiar
customer_reviews.author: Failure Not an Option

customer_reviews.title: Good. But with issues
customer_reviews.text: Good remote. Has some issues though. If dropped or bumped, even lightly it reboots and you have to go through the process of doing to beginners help guide. Not long though, just cover front with your hand so it doesn't make the program being watched go out of whack. Also, using the activities button it's difficult...near impossible to switch between activities and have the remote correctly control the other devices.
customer_reviews.author: Miles

customer_reviews.title: Love my Logitech
customer_reviews.text: This is replacing a previous Logitech harmony universal remote that died after 3yr. I do miss the glow button but this one will glow when you movie it. So far it's working great. Had bought one of this model at Christmas and it died after 2 1/2 months. I just love the light up digital screen. If I have a problem I push help and it will ask questions until the problem is solved. Set up is pretty easy, a littlle bit of time but so worth it. One remote to control 4 devices is the ultimate in lazy and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Southern

customer_reviews.title: Bought used... scratched up bad.
customer_reviews.text: Bought Used-Good. which is supposed to be near new condition.. the LSD cover is scratched up like someone took a knife to it... so.. yeah.. buyer beware.. EDIT: Just went to put batteries in... and the battery compartment is full of white scale from batteries being left in it...
customer_reviews.author: Icetech

customer_reviews.title: it was great for the first month or so
customer_reviews.text: POS! it was great for the first month or so, then things got difficult. I had to re-something it almost every time I used it. Push this button then push this button? Yeah so then I decided to reprogram the remote because I have made changes to my AV system and I couldn't. I was required to install all sorts of CRAP on to my PC? After a few hours of downloads and agreements I still could not get my remote re-programed. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Longboltz

customer_reviews.title: harmony's are the s***
customer_reviews.text: i have two harmony's now, my first one was the cheapest they have with no screen or backlighting. i love that one cause i don't really need all of the screen touch and fancy hundred dollar stuff. this one is more expensive than my other one and has some quirky differences from my other one but i got used to it real quick and so did my happy wife, we may even prefer this one. the main thing is that this baby is backlit, backlit, backlit and under a hundred bucks. deal.
customer_reviews.author: Waicool

customer_reviews.title: Great Remote, easy to set up, great customer support
customer_reviews.text: This is actually a really good product and it is dead easy set up. In fact it almost sets itself up. This remote allowed me to get rid of 8 other remotes  And at reduced price of $56 - it is great value Highly recommended- but you will almost certainly need some telephone customer support to achieve some very fine tuning - fortunately, customer support is very good!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Therrien

customer_reviews.title: Good remote.
customer_reviews.text: After my last remote (Harmony One) unfortunately met it's end during a Bruins Playoff game a few years back. I didn't want to spend all that money again. This thing works just as well as the Harmony One, lacks a few features that one had, but it is a fraction of the price. Easy setup, no problems with my system (which is pretty extensive). I would say I also recommend the Harmony One, if you don't have a bad temper like me.
customer_reviews.author: B. Young

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I have several differing items that required differing remotes. Especially my television, no other universal I had found could connect to my television and the Logitech came through for me. Now I don't have 4 remotes, I have 1. It was easy set up. The hardest part is getting all the model numbers , if they are not on the front of the item. Overall very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Luckalaska

customer_reviews.title: Works great but...
customer_reviews.text: It takes a little time to set up, since you have to connect it to the website and download the codes. But when you are done, it works perfectly (and has an assistant when it forgets something). My problem is with the design. I use the numeric keypad and it is in the wrong place. You cannot comfortably press the number 9 without using 2 hands. I wish designers were forced to use the products they designed before releasing them on the public.
customer_reviews.author: Foggyview

customer_reviews.title: Good price, Strong multi Remote
customer_reviews.text: We broke our previous Logitech and needed to replace it, but, we did not have the funds, and low and behold, Logitech had a feature rich device with LIGHT UP buttons, and a small screen !!! It works JUST perfect !!! I am a Mac User and the Software, hardware all works just fine. I may want to buy another as back up, then things tend to break when dropped !
customer_reviews.author: John Benicy

customer_reviews.title: Good Remote For The Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for a previous Logitech remote. It does all I need a remote for (and then some by allowing one-button multi-step activities) by replacing 5 of the 6 electronics' remotes I have. The only one not replaced is an old VCR I no longer use anyway. I like the easy internet application to program the remote and was easily able to transfer my activities from the previous Logitech remote to the new one. All this for under $60.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Cramer

customer_reviews.title: Good remote, great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for almost one year, and while it worked great up until a few weeks ago, I've had problems with some of the buttons not working, or working incorrectly. I contacted Logitech, and within one week have had the issue resolved. They're replacing it with a new Harmony 650 remote. Their customer service is very good, and I'd purchase another one.
customer_reviews.author: BobT

customer_reviews.title: Close to loving it
customer_reviews.text: I am close to absolutely loving this remote and actually would give it a 4.90 if I could - it is by far the most simple (necessary for the impatient hubby) remote I have ever had. A few tires to program ( not al devices have a model number). I would only like to be able to program aspect for my TV - without this feature, I still have to keep other remotes close by as out cable doesn't automatically adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer Gal

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but well worth it.
customer_reviews.text: It frequently freezes up, but when it's working, it's working well. I may have just received a faulty unit, but sometimes the remote is unresponsive. I still love the thing though. I'd definitely recommend it. Make sure you don't need one that can control more than 5 devices at once though, as that is the limit for this remote.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Krump

customer_reviews.title: I Hope This One Will Last as Long as the Harmony H659
customer_reviews.text: I purchased another Harmony remote because the first one I had lasted eight years. I had to replace it since most of the buttons were worn and not working well. I ordered the Harmony 600, and it worked less than a week and all of a sudden it didn't work. The power was completely gone. Apparently the contact for the battery was not real snug, so the remote didn't work . After going through lots of testing with the Logitech site, it was reprogrammed after I adjusted the battery contact area. A couple months later it is still working.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Powell

customer_reviews.title: Simple & Easy
customer_reviews.text: This product from Logitech has cleared the clutter from our coffee table. Surprisngly it has been real easy to use. My roommate and I have no problem with the product. Better yet, our guests have no problem adapting to it. Best part is we can make activities happen in a few seconds rather than a couple minutes. Worth the pennies!
customer_reviews.author: Herrminator

customer_reviews.title: For me, this is a great remote.
customer_reviews.text: If you are tech minded, it is fairly easy to set up on your computer, and it unlikely your devices will not be in their data base. If you have the original remote(s) you can even use a learn function if needed (ifr only).... it handles up to five devices. If you need more get the Harmony One. If not, save your money and get the 600 or the 650. Most likely you will be pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Great multidevice remote
customer_reviews.text: Highest recommendation. Used between a Samsung TV, Comcast STB, Sony TV and Mac Mini. controlled everything perfectly on the first run through the setup program. Lesson learned there: Use Firefox to run the setup from the website on a Mac. Neither Safari nor Chrome would detect the Silverlight plugin necessary to run the Logitech setup.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent remote control
customer_reviews.text: Excellent remote control Very good power and easy to handle. Very pleasant to the touch.
customer_reviews.author: Hector Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great Product

Of course it takes some tweaking to get all the settings just right. The range of supported devices is abysmal, chances are you can control almost anything with large of customization possible. My wilfe loves it and we do recomend this to all.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Berger

customer_reviews.title: Love the setup of these remotes and they truly can ...
customer_reviews.text: First one was returned. Second one worked for about 1 year and just died. Since I already had a return with Logitech they said they wouldn't warranty another. Love the setup of these remotes and they truly can do anything but it's hard to ignore the hardware issues. The backlight is great as well. Too bad these didn't work out.
customer_reviews.author: ReviewGuy

customer_reviews.title: Good, but fragile
customer_reviews.text: There are other reviews that cover the technical aspects of it quite well. It's a good remote, but it's also somewhat fragile; ours broke after dropping from a coffee table onto a rug. I don't expect a remote to be indestructible, but it should be durable enough to endure a small drop.

This thing walks you through simple YES/NO questions (like, "is the TV on?" (no) "Did that fix the problem?" and as you answer them on the remote, it fixes the problem. Its seriously magical.

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Harmony 600 Universal Remote

Super easy to setup or reprogram. Just download the Logitech Harmony program to your desktop, then plug the remotes into your USB port on the computer and follow the On-Screen Logitech setup page. The remotes also have a smaller IR window on the back end of the remote where you can use your old remote to reassign commands from it to the Logitech. We both really like em!

customer_reviews.title: Very Sensitive but pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: I found this remote easy to program and use. It allowed me to control my soundbar, DISH, and TV (DISH remote will not program to control soundbars...VERY ANNOYING). BUT my wife and son could not get the hang of it, so I bought a $10 Phillips remote at Walmart that works great. I had to run thru the trouble shooting prompts at least 100 times in 2 weeks b/c they either turned on a component without using the remote or bumped it on something or dropped it. I will keep it for my personal use in another room.

product_meta.title: Logitech Harmony 600 Universal Remote
product_meta.description: Logitech Harmony 600 Universal Remote is the universal remote that’s simple to set up and use. Its backlit screen shows the commands you need for the devices you’re using, and can even provide help if you need it. And its one-click activity buttons automatically turn on the right devices and select the right settings depending on what you want to do. It replaces five other remotes and supports 5000+ brands and 225,000+ devices, so you can be confident it will work with what you own today, and the things you’ll add in the future.
